	 function loadScript(scriptURL){
        // load script
        var scriptTAG = document.createElement('script');
        scriptTAG.type = 'application/javascript';
        scriptTAG.async = true;
        scriptTAG.src = scriptURL;
        document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(scriptTAG);
      }

      function loadCSS(CSSURL){
        // load css
        var linkTAG = document.createElement('link');
        linkTAG.rel = "stylesheet";
        linkTAG.type = 'text/css';
        linkTAG.href = CSSURL;
        document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(linkTAG);
      }
      if(!navigator.onLine){

        loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site.min.css');
        loadScript('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-base.min.js');

      		loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site/templates/clientlib-site-event-details.min.css');

                                                <div class="col-12 section-heading-col">
                                                    <h3>2024 digital media trends</h3>
                                                    <h4>Introduction</h4>
                                                    <p>
                                                    This year’s <i>Digital Media Trends</i> point to continued industry disruption—not just from streaming, social, and gaming, but also from how these media and technologies combine. As these disruptions mature, their convergence sets up the next revolutions. Companies need to lead these advancements—or risk living in another’s vision.
                                                    </p>
                                                    <a href="javascript:void(0)" data-href="/us/en/insights/industry/technology/digital-media-trends-consumption-habits-survey/2024/digital-media-trends-introduction.html" tabindex="0" aria-label="Read the full introduction" class="frame-link" data-title="introduction" data-analytics-label="introduction:an-introduction-to-link-click">

                                                        <strong>Read the full introduction</strong>
                                                    </a>

                                <section id="key-themes" class="fade-element fadeIn scroll-to">
                                    <div class="section-bg-white section-margin-default section-article">
                                        <div class="container">

                                                        <img src="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2024/january/digital-media-trends-2024/assets/related-content-4.png" class="img-fluid" alt="Will endless low-cost image" data-analytics-label="related-content:will-endless-low-image-click">
                                                        <div class="article-box" data-analytics-label="related-content:will-endless-low-title-click">
                                                            <h3>
                                                            Will endless low-cost content do to gaming what it did to TV and film?
                                                            </h3>
                                                            <p>
                                                            UGC gaming platforms that incentivize user-generated content are expected to make big payouts to creators in 2024. As this practice grows, however, it could put pressure on top-tier games and services.
                                                            </p>

    function getCookie(name) 
    {
        var dc = document.cookie;
        var prefix = name + "=";
        var begin = dc.indexOf("; " + prefix);
        if (begin == -1) {
            begin = dc.indexOf(prefix);
            if (begin != 0) return null;
        }
        else
        {
            begin += 2;
            var end = document.cookie.indexOf(";", begin);
            if (end == -1) {
                end = dc.length;
            }
        }
        return unescape(dc.substring(begin + prefix.length, end));
    }
